definitions.definition: A white blood cell that phagocytizes necrotic cell debris and foreign material, including viruses , bacteria , and tattoo ink . It presents foreign antigens on MHC II to lymphocytes . Part of the innate immune system .

main_definition: ( immunology , cytology ) A white blood cell that phagocytizes necrotic cell debris and foreign material, including viruses , bacteria , and tattoo ink . It presents foreign antigens on MHC II to lymphocytes . Part of the innate immune system .
